clinical_study.brief_title: Speech Hero Home Therapy for Aphasia
clinical_study.official_title: Speech Hero: a Rhythm-based Speech Therapy App for Individuals With Aphasia

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will run an at-home usability study of a newly developed speech therapy app called Speech Hero with 10 individuals with Broca's aphasia in the chronic stage of stroke. The Speech Hero app allows users to perform rhythm-based speech exercises at home. For this study participants will be instructed to use Speech Hero for three hours per week over a 3-week period.

primary_outcome.description: Speech Hero will be deemed feasible for this population if at least 5 participants perform the recommended 9 hours of speech therapy (3 hours each week) at home using the Speech Hero system (as measured by the Speech Hero app) with no safety concerns or adverse events.

secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of language function of adults with suspected neurological disorders as a result of a stroke, head injury, or dementia.
Assessment to measure word retrieval in individuals with aphasia or other language disturbance caused by stroke, Alzheimer's disease, or other dementing disorders.
Usability will be assessed using a modified version of the System Usability Scale, which is a 10 item questionnaire designed to capture a user's subjective view of a system's usability.

intervention.intervention_name: At home Speech Hero therapy app
intervention.description: Participants will be instructed to use the Speech Hero therapy app for three hours per week over a 3-week period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of Broca's aphasia due to stroke,
- >6 months post stroke
- sufficient motor function of the unaffected upper extremity to tap on a table while speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Incidence of other neurological diseases (though individuals with apraxia will be included)
- age <85
